date:   2018-07-24 21:13:40 +0100
categories: r jekyll
---

This post was written using R Markdown. I followed instructions [here](https://selbydavid.com/2017/06/16/rmarkdown-jekyll/)

This means I can generate plots:

```{r plot}
plot(iris$Petal.Width, iris$Petal.Length,
     col = as.numeric(iris$Species) + 1,
     xlab = 'Petal Width', ylab = 'Petal Length',
     main = "Fisher's iris data")
```

And nicely-formatted tables:

```{r table, results = 'asis'}
knitr::kable(head(iris))
```
